1. Pipette out 1ml of 10mg ml<sup>-1</sup> protein sample \(critical in PBS and pure and homogeneous) each in two 1.5ml eppendorf tubes.
2. Cover the tubes with aluminum foil.
Add any chemicals to this tube.
Add 20μl of 1M DMAB solution followed by 40μL of 1M formaldehyde solution to the “methylated” tube.

4. Shake both the tubes \(“control” and “methylated”) at 4 °C in dark on a gel shaker maintained at 100 rpm for 2 h. 
  5.
Incubate for 12 h at 4 °C in the dark while shaking.

Run size exclusion chromatography on “control” and “methylated” protein using 20mM Tris, 150mM NaCl, pH8.0 for buffer exchange.
  8.

Concentrate “control” and “methylated” protein to ~ 10-15 mg ml<sup>-1</sup> 
  9.
Analyze proteins using SDS PAGE and mass spectroscopy.
Screen control and methylated protein for crystallization under identical conditions.
